channel.title: Server Wont Go Online
channel.description: Hi im trying to put my rsc server online and i changed the ip in the settings file and i tried to connect and it didnt work but it works on 127.0.0.1 a.k.a LocalHost

item.title: Server Wont Go Online
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

[quote=“FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz, post:10, topic:393919”][quote author=Pompano21 link=topic=491104.msg3592035#msg3592035 date=1304721592]

To see the error go to ant/bin/ant.bat(not .cmd), and go to end of the file and type ‘pause’ after :omega

Wow you know everything l0l but heres the error:
Unable to locate tools.jar. Expected to find it in C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\li
b\tools.jar
Buildfile: build.xml

runserver:
[java] java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/rscdaemon/server/Server
[java] Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.rscdaemon.server.Se
rver
[java] at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
[java] at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
[java] at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
[java] at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
[java] at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
[java] at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
[java] Could not find the main class: org.rscdaemon.server.Server. Program
will exit.
[java] Exception in thread “main”
[java] Java Result: 1

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 4 seconds
Press any key to continue . . .

Lol you need to compile your serberrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr
[/quote]
lol im not retarded i did that way before i posted my comment it still doesnt work.[/quote]
“Unable to locate tools.jar” I had this error before, just add the tools.jar in the folder. It most likely isn’t there
go into your Java/Jdk/Lib
There should be a tools.jar there, copy it and put it in your
c:/program files/java/jre6/lib

Read full topic

item.title: Server Wont Go Online
item.dc:creator: @FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz
item.description:
@FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:5, topic:393919"]EasyRSC? Oh there shouldn’t be there then, I assumed that you were using RSCD v2.5 or RSCAngels source.

Go to src->org.rscdaemon.server and open up Server.java

Now search for this line

Change the localhost to your local ip(Found by cmd->ipconfig) like I sayed in previous post. and compile.[/quote]
ok and i did that and now i hav this run error it keeps closing like 3 seconds after running it says something about main but i cant copy anything from it cause it closes to fast.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Wont Go Online
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

EasyRSC? Oh there shouldn’t be there then, I assumed that you were using RSCD v2.5 or RSCAngels source.

Go to src->org.rscdaemon.server and open up Server.java

Now search for this line

Change the localhost to your local ip(Found by cmd->ipconfig) like I sayed in previous post. and compile.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Wont Go Online
item.dc:creator: @FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz
item.description:
@FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:3, topic:393919"]I’ll explain it better since keith isn’t capable of.

For RSCD v25 based sources:

First you have to know your local ip, you can get it by going to Start->Run…->cmd and writing ipconfig, where it says IP Address it’s the address you’re looking for.

Open world.xml with somekind of editor(notepad, notepad++ etc.)
You will see

RSCD Config 514 [b]192.168.0.100[/b] 43594 FreeToPK Finland members 800 1 [b]localhost[/b] 34522 d2d33dt

Now change the ip from the bold line.

Now open up ls.conf:

[quote]
RSCD-LS Config
localhost
rscd
root

localhost
34522
d2d33dt
192.168.0.100
8181

[/quote]
Now it all should work fine serverside. Now change the ip address of the client to your ip and you’re done.[/quote]
i looked for world.xml and couldnt find it and i searched in the config file and couldnt find it either im using easyrsc.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Wont Go Online
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

I’ll explain it better since keith isn’t capable of.

For RSCD v25 based sources:

First you have to know your local ip, you can get it by going to Start->Run…->cmd and writing ipconfig, where it says IP Address it’s the address you’re looking for.

Open world.xml with somekind of editor(notepad, notepad++ etc.)
You will see

RSCD Config 514 [b]192.168.0.100[/b] 43594 FreeToPK Finland members 800 1 [b]localhost[/b] 34522 d2d33dt

Now change the ip from the bold line.

Now open up ls.conf:

RSCD-LS Config localhost rscd root [b]localhost[/b] 34522 d2d33dt [b]192.168.0.100[/b] 8181
Now it all should work fine serverside. Now change the ip address of the client to your ip and you're done.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Wont Go Online
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

Making everything localhost for the settings.

Then go into world.xml put your Static IP address for the IP entry make sure to have port 43594 forwarded
Then other people should be able to login.
Make the ls Ip localhost

Read full topic
